reviews.text: Nice and simple for a Rail station. Manned most of the time, easy pickup point, not that much to it. Has an on-site cafe, Pen Mill Hotel is the nearest Pub & accommodation, Royal Marine Inn is tucked away and cheaper & more approachable. Path cutthroughs to "country park" useful as a shortcut to the town centre. Looks the same distance on the map, but doesn't go over an inconvenient hill.

The gentleman selling the tickets is an absolute star, always polite, very informative and particularly today!
I got to the station, bought my ticket then popped to the ladies. I came out to see my train to Bath leaving the station! Completely my own fault but he was very caring and kind. Refunded my ticket then suggested that I could get a train to Weymouth which I did and had a lovely day out.
This man is an absolute gem and is an asset to the station

It seems a pleasant small town station, neat and tidy with staffed ticket office, waiting room and toilet facilities.  
There is a free car park and cosy tea room. 
Train services are available to Dorchester, Weymouth, Westbury, Bath and Bristol and changes onwards.  
The old style signals and signal box make it a lovely little spot.

Small station with 2 platforms and services the Westbury to Weymouth line with those trains run by GWR - introduction of some trains to Yeovil junction, and London  via Yeovil or Westbury (run by SWT)

Booking office usually open but can be shut if not enough staff and also information board is available 

No lifts at the station with an old fashioned bridge though there is a way of getting push chairs and bikes off rather than carrying them over 

The only draw back that it is a walk to the centre of Yeovil, but it is along the old railway line and is signposted
no problems, not very big but no problems.
